alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 7:22AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Howard and Sevier. Portions of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, McCurtain. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Umpire, Gillham, Athens, Hochatown, Watson, Smithville, Sherwood, Plunketville, Mount Herman, Bethel, Battiest, Pickens, Ringold and Burg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
